title: Cursor Rules Format
description: JSON Schema for Cursor .cursor/rules format with MDC (Markdown Components) frontmatter

description.description: Human-readable description of what this rule does (REQUIRED by Cursor). Used by AI to determine relevance for 'Apply Intelligently' type.

globs.description: File patterns to apply this rule to. When specified, creates 'Apply to Specific Files' rule type.

alwaysApply.description: Whether to apply this rule to all files. true = 'Always Apply' type, false (default) = 'Apply Intelligently' or file-specific based on globs.

name.description: Package identifier (PRPM extension, ignored by Cursor)

tags.description: Categorization tags (PRPM extension, ignored by Cursor)

agentType.description: Marks as agent subtype (PRPM extension for round-trip conversion)

skillType.description: Marks as skill subtype (PRPM extension for round-trip conversion)

commandType.description: Marks as slash command subtype (PRPM extension for round-trip conversion)

content.description: Markdown content following the frontmatter. Standard markdown with headings, lists, code blocks, etc.

frontmatter.description: Core coding standards that apply to all files

examples.content:
# Core Coding Standards

These standards apply to every chat session.

- Write self-documenting code
- Keep functions under 50 lines

frontmatter.description: RPC Service boilerplate patterns and conventions

examples.content:
# RPC Service Patterns

Agent will include this when it detects RPC service context.

- Use internal RPC pattern
- Use snake_case for service names

# React Component Standards

Applied only to React component files.

- Use functional components with hooks
